title: 'Negligence in construction': Police loo leak suspected in Indore water tragedy; questions mount
content: Tragedy struck Bhagirathpura as 10 residents died from contaminated drinking water, with locals blaming a police outpost toilet built without a proper septic tank. Sewage reportedly seeped into the water pipeline, leading to the fatal contamination. Residents are demanding culpable homicide charges against those responsible for this grave negligence.

title: US strikes in Venezuela: Did Trump have authority to capture Maduro? What the law says
content: US forces conducted a large-scale strike in Venezuela, capturing President Nicol√°s Maduro and his wife, Cilia Flores, following pre-dawn attacks on Caracas. Maduro faces terrorism and drug charges in New York, with the US accusing him of leading a narco-terrorist organization. The operation's legality is debated, with experts citing potential violations of international law.

title: ‚ÄòWhy only Mahayuti?‚Äô: Oppn slams 68 unopposed Maha civic wins; alleges bribery, threats
content: A significant number of Mahayuti candidates secured unopposed victories in municipal polls, with the BJP leading the count. Opposition leaders decried the situation, alleging widespread use of money and threats to force withdrawals, and accused the state election commission of bias. Allegations of bribery and undue influence were prominent.

title: Odisha rock collapse: Several people feared dead, rescue operation underway
content: Several people are feared dead following a massive rock collapse at a stone quarry in Odisha's Dhenkanal district on Saturday evening. The incident occurred during drilling and stone exploration, trapping workers under debris. Rescue operations are underway with multiple teams deployed to the site.

title: Gurmeet Ram Rahim granted 40-day parole, will remain at Sirsa headquarters
content: Dera Sacha Sauda chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim Singh, serving sentences for rape and murder, has been granted a 40-day parole. This marks his 15th release from Sunaria Jail, Rohtak, since his 2017 conviction. He will spend his parole period at the Dera headquarters in Sirsa.

title: EV race: Tesla loses top spot; Chinese rival becomes world‚Äôs biggest EV seller
content: Chinese automaker BYD has surged past Tesla to become the world's largest seller of battery electric vehicles in 2025, reporting 2.25 million sales. This marks a significant shift, with Tesla experiencing a decline. BYD's success stems from its diverse, affordable models and technological advancements, alongside aggressive international expansion.

title: Drama! IPL broadcast to be suspended in Bangladesh?
content: Bangladesh Cricket Board seeks to shift T20 World Cup matches from India to Sri Lanka due to player safety concerns after Mustafizur Rahman's IPL contract cancellation. They also requested a suspension of IPL broadcasts in Bangladesh, citing disrespect to their cricketers and nation.

title: Maduro captured: Who is in charge of Venezuela now? Trump says US will 'run' the country
content: Following President Nicolas Maduro's capture by the US military, Venezuela's highest court has appointed Vice President Delcy Rodriguez as interim president. The US operation, citing narco-terrorism links, aims to ensure a "safe, proper and judicious transition" and re-establish US oil company operations. Rodriguez, however, has rejected the US action and demanded Maduro's release

title: CBSE Class 10, 12 Practical exams 2026: Board issues strict guidelines; check notice
content: CBSE has issued strict guidelines for Class 10 and 12 practical exams from January 1-14, 2026. Schools must ensure adequate resources, inform students, and use only Board-appointed examiners. Special arrangements are mandated for students with special needs. Marks must be uploaded daily and accurately, with no exemptions for sports participation. Non-compliance risks exam cancellation.

title: Warren Buffett's biggest tech regret: Missing Google's IPO; Finally invests after 21 years
content: Warren Buffett and the late Charlie Munger finally ended their decades-long regret by acquiring a $4.3 billion stake in Alphabet, Google's parent company, in Q3 2025. This move, driven by firsthand experience of Google's advertising prowess through GEICO, signals Berkshire Hathaway's growing confidence in Alphabet's AI ambitions and its core search business.

title: New seats, modern washrooms & more ‚Äî Here's how Vande Bharat Sleeper looks from inside!
content: Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw unveiled the new Vande Bharat sleeper train, promising enhanced comfort for overnight journeys with upgraded amenities like improved suspension and modern washrooms.  The first service, connecting Guwahati and Kolkata, is set to launch in January 2026, with fares starting at Rs 2,300.

title: Mustafizur controversy: Bangladesh seek shift of T20 World Cup games from India
content: Bangladesh's sports ministry has directed the cricket board to request the ICC shift T20 World Cup matches from India to Sri Lanka. This follows concerns over player safety after Mustafizur Rahman's IPL removal, reportedly due to recent political developments and deteriorating Indo-Bangladesh relations.

title: Watch: Fire erupts at Thrissur railway station; hundreds of two-wheelers gutted in blaze
content: Hundreds of two-wheelers were destroyed in a massive fire at the Thrissur railway station's paid parking area on Sunday morning. The blaze, suspected to have started from a fallen electric line igniting a covered bike, gutted most of the approximately 400 vehicles. Firefighters brought the flames under control, preventing spread to station platforms.

title: One passport claim: Elon Musk speaks on citizenship: ‚ÄòI will live and die in America‚Äô
content: Elon Musk stated he holds only an American passport and intends to live and die in the US, or Mars. Born in South Africa, he obtained Canadian citizenship at 17 before transferring to the University of Pennsylvania in 1992 on a J-1 Exchange Visit visa. He later became a naturalized US citizen in 2002.

title: UP horror: 5-year old girl dies after she was raped, thrown from 3rd floor
content: A five-year-old girl was abducted, gang-raped, and then thrown from a third-floor building in Bulandshahr, allegedly by two men. The accused, who were reportedly drinking at the time, attempted to stage the incident as an accident.

title: Damien Martyn health update: Family shares big news on hospitalised Aussie cricketer
content: Former Australian cricketer Damien Martyn, who was recently hospitalised with meningitis and placed in an induced coma, is now on the road to recovery. His family expressed gratitude to hospital staff, confirming his "progressing well." Martyn, a 54-year-old former batter, had a distinguished career, including two World Cup wins and 13 Test centuries.

title: York family net worth: How a $13M bet became the 49ers‚Äô $8.4B empire
content: Forbes ranks San Francisco 49ers owner Denise DeBartolo York and her family at $8.4 Billion, placing them ahead of Donald Trump and Mark Cuban. The York family controls over 90% of the 49ers, now valued above $8 Billion, after decades of growth tied to NFL success and global sports investments, according to Forbes 2025 rankings released in September this year.

title: Magic Johnson & Cookie Johnson 2025 net worth: Earnings and endorsements
content: NBA legend Magic Johnson and his wife, Cookie, boast a combined net worth of $1.6 billion. Magic's fortune stems from his basketball career and a vast business empire, including stakes in the Los Angeles Dodgers. Cookie has carved her own path as a successful author and entrepreneur, contributing significantly to their wealth and advocating for AIDS awareness.

title: Brittany Mahomes shares New Year glimpse as Patrick Mahomes continues rehab
content: Patrick Mahomes is entering 2026 focused entirely on rehab after suffering ACL and LCL tears late in the season. A New Year post from Brittany Mahomes confirmed he is still on crutches, reinforcing the long road ahead. Andy Reid stressed patience, noting Mahomes remains around the team while prioritizing recovery over travel or timelines.

title: Who is Delcy Rodriguez? Venezuelan leader named interim president after Maduro‚Äôs capture
content: Venezuela entered a period of uncertainty after President Nicol√°s Maduro was captured during a US military operation. With no immediate political transition announced, the Supreme Court ordered Vice President Delcy Rodr√≠guez to step in as interim president. Rodr√≠guez condemned the US action, demanded Maduro‚Äôs release, and insisted he remains the country‚Äôs legitimate leader, even as she took charge of government functions alongside senior ministers and military officials.

title: This space technology change how we manage Earth‚Äôs orbit
content: Space junk poses a growing threat to vital satellite services. Scientists at CU Boulder are developing an electrostatic tractor beam, a non-contact technology that gently nudges debris to de-orbit. This innovative approach, inspired by science fiction but grounded in physics, offers a safer and more efficient alternative to traditional cleanup methods, potentially revolutionizing orbital debris management.

title: Ankita Bhandari murder case: No ‚ÄòVIP‚Äô involved, says Haridwar SP; opposition demands CBI probe
content: Police state no VIP was involved in the Ankita Bhandari murder case. A man named Dharmendra Kumar was identified as a friend, not a VIP. New allegations suggest a 'Gattu', a top BJP leader, is involved. The Uttarakhand government is open to investigation with credible evidence.

title: The stray-dog row that put school teachers on the hook; here's why they're pushing back
content: A Supreme Court safety order on stray dogs in institutional areas set off a chain of circulars: Ministry, CBSE, then Delhi DoE. Social media then twisted ‚Äúnodal officer‚Äù coordination into a false ‚Äúteachers counting dogs‚Äù claim, prompting police action and a teacher‚Äôs suspension. Mumbai teachers resisted similar nodal roles. The bigger fight isn‚Äôt dogs‚Äîit‚Äôs non-teaching duties and accountability.

title: Typhoid outbreak: 70 cases in Gujarat as sewage taints water; Gandhinagar opens 30-bed ward
content: Gandhinagar is grappling with a typhoid outbreak linked to contaminated drinking water, with 70 active cases reported. Leaks in the newly laid water supply system have allowed sewage to mix with potable water, prompting health officials to intensify outpatient checks and open a pediatric ward. Authorities are working to plug leakages and are hopeful of containing the outbreak soon.

title: Maha civic polls: '68' candidates set for 'unopposed wins'; SEC to invoke 2014 directive
content: Over 60 candidates in Maharashtra's municipal corporation elections are poised for unopposed victories. The State Election Commission will adhere to a 2014 directive, ensuring thorough verification of these candidates before official declaration. This process aims to maintain transparency and uphold election norms, even in cases of single-candidate races due to withdrawals or local agreements.

title: Delhi AQI ‚Äòpoor‚Äô at 298, IMD issues yellow alert as several regions hit ‚Äòvery poor‚Äô
content: Delhi's air quality remained in the 'poor' category with an AQI of 298 on Sunday, causing breathing discomfort. Several areas recorded 'very poor' air, while fog impacted flight operations. Authorities urge adherence to GRAP guidelines despite Stage-III restrictions being revoked.

title: ‚ÄòScared to drink tap water‚Äô: After Indore contamination row, trust in municipal supply dries up
content: Indore's reputation for cleanliness is shattered as a water contamination crisis in Bhagirathpura leads to deaths and hospitalizations. Residents now fear municipal tap water, opting for costly bottled alternatives. Authorities are implementing awareness campaigns and chlorination efforts to restore trust and control the outbreak.

title: Power banks banned from inflight charging: DGCA issues safety circular
content: India has prohibited charging power banks inflight and using them with in-seat power systems due to the risk of lithium batteries catching fire. Power banks and batteries are now only permitted in hand luggage, not overhead bins, following DGCA directives to enhance flight safety. Airlines must report all lithium battery-related incidents to the DGCA.

title: Sara Arjun thanks ‚Äòmy strongest Dhurandhars‚Äô after success
content: Sara Arjun, who made her debut as a leading lady with Aditya Dhar‚Äôs espionage thriller Dhurandhar, is basking in the film‚Äôs massive success. The 20-year-old actor, who has been working in cinema since childhood, played Yaleena opposite Ranveer Singh in the film, which has emerged as one of the year‚Äôs biggest box office successes, collecting Rs 759 crore net so far.

title: Zubeen Garg death probe: Manager killed him for money, says SIT; court issues notices
content: In a shocking twist unveiled in court, Assam Police presented startling evidence suggesting that Zubeen Garg's former manager, Siddharth Sharma, may have taken the singer's life to secure capital for a Rs 1.10 crore packaged water plant.

title: 'Injustice': Bengal coach slams Shami's omission; calls decision 'shameful'
content: Shubman Gill will captain India's ODI squad against New Zealand, with Shreyas Iyer as vice-captain pending fitness. Mohammed Siraj returns to the pace attack, but Mohammed Shami's omission has drawn criticism from Bengal's head coach, who called the decision unfair despite Shami's recent domestic form and past contributions.

title: US strikes Venezuela: MEA issues advisory for Indians; urges to avoid non-essential travel
content: India's Ministry of External Affairs has strongly advised its citizens to avoid non-essential travel to Venezuela following multiple strikes by the United States. "All Indians who are in Venezuela for any reason are advised to exercise extreme caution, restrict their movements, and remain in contact with Embassy of India in Caracas," the ministry's advisory read.

title: Why old books smell so good, according to science
content: The distinct aroma of old books arises from the slow chemical breakdown of paper, ink, glue, and binding materials. Volatile organic compounds are released as cellulose and lignin degrade, with vanillin and acetic acid contributing sweet and sharp notes. Storage conditions, handling, and the presence of various components collectively shape this characteristic scent.

title: Big Bash: At 39, Warner equals Kohli in this record; goes past Rohit
content: Warner remained unbeaten on 130 from 65 balls at Engie Stadium on Saturday. He hit nine sixes and 11 fours as Sydney Thunder posted 205 for 4.

title: Ballari clash: 23 detained after BJP MLA Janardhana Reddy files counter-complaints
content: BJP MLA G Janardhana Reddy and his manager filed complaints against 23 people, including Congress MLA Nara Bharath Reddy, alleging trespassing and assault following clashes during a statue unveiling. The violence resulted in the death of a Congress worker, with compensation provided to his family. Political leaders are demanding action and probes into the incidents.

title: 'Dhurandhar' box office collection: Ranveer Singh, Akshaye Khanna‚Äôs film refuses to slow down
content: Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' continues its reign at the box office, nearing Rs 760 crore in India and Rs 1200 crore worldwide after 30 days. The espionage thriller saw a significant surge over the weekend, earning over Rs 10 crore on its 5th Saturday. Meanwhile, 'Ikkis' is performing steadily, while 'Tu Meri Main Tera Tu Meri' struggles.

title: 'Ikkis' box office collection: Agastya, Dharmendra starrer hits Rs 15 crore mark
content: Agastya Nanda's war film 'Ikkis' shows modest box office growth, earning an estimated Rs 15.15 crore net in India. Despite positive reviews for its emotional narrative and Dharmendra's role, it struggles against the dominance of Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar'. The film highlights Second Lieutenant Arun Khetarpal's bravery in the 1971 war.

title: ‚ÄòMere theatrics‚Äô: UP gangster posts live videos claiming cop threat; Rs 30 cr properties seized
content: Gangster Haji Firoz Khan chained himself at home, rigged a noose, and installed CCTV cameras, posting live videos to claim an immediate threat from Uttar Pradesh police. Police dismissed the act as theatrics, stating Khan has been issuing such updates since Wednesday to affirm his well-being amid warnings of suicide if arrested.

title: Being on waitlist does not guarantee hiring, says Allahabad high court
content: The Allahabad High Court ruled that waitlisted candidates do not have an absolute right to appointment, and waitlists cannot exist indefinitely. This decision came after a petition by candidates who were initially not selected for assistant teacher posts. The court emphasized that selection processes must conclude within a reasonable timeframe.

title: A‚Äôja Wilson vs Sophie Cunningham net worth 2025: WNBA salary and endorsements
content: WNBA stars A'ja Wilson and Sophie Cunningham are making significant strides both on and off the court. Wilson, a Las Vegas Aces powerhouse, boasts a $4 million net worth with lucrative endorsements and a $200k annual salary. Meanwhile, Indiana Fever's Cunningham, with a $2 million net worth, earns $100k annually from her contract and brand deals.

title: Mike Evans injury update: Is Buccaneers WR playing this week?
content: Star wide receiver Mike Evans is expected to play in the crucial Week 18 game for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, with his playoff hopes on the line. Despite a missed practice, the team confirmed it was a strategic rest day for the veteran, not an injury concern.

title: "Act Of War": Mamdani Speaks To Trump Over Capture Of Venezuela's Maduro
content: New York City Mayor Zohran Mamdani has said he spoke with President Donald Trump "directly" to register his opposition to the capture of Venezuelan President Nicols Maduro and his wife by the US military.

title: Use Of Power Banks For Charging Devices On Flights Banned Over Fire Risk
content: India's aviation regulator, the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA), said that power banks and spare batteries will be allowed only in hand luggage and cannot be stored in overhead compartments.

title: "Might Is Right": Shashi Tharoor Assesses Trump's Kinetic Move On Maduro
content: Former diplomat Shashi Tharoor has given his frank assessment of the US action against Venezuela and its President Nicolas Maduro. It is all about "might is right".

title: Eknath Shinde Calls Thackeray Cousins' Love For Marathi People "Fake"
content: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde on Saturday slammed Uddhav Thackeray and Raj Thackeray, claiming their love for Marathi manoos' is fake and that their real interest lies in the coffers of the cash-rich BMC.

title: US Lifts Caribbean Airspace Restrictions After Venezuela Strike
content: US Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy said in a post on social media platform X that the initial restrictions expired at 12:00 am (0500 GMT), when flights could resume as scheduled.

title: Man Discovers He Got Fake Result From Scammers After IAS Centre Visit
content: A man with a fake UPSC result that showed him as qualified for civil services arrived at the Lal Bahadur Shastri National Academy of Administration (LBSNAA) here on Saturday for training.

title: Maduro In New York Jail, His Number 2 To Lead Venezuela: 10 Points
content: Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro was put in a New York jail on Saturday, hours after US forces captured him in a late-night raid and flew him out of the South American country. Maduro's deputy, Delcy Rodriguez, has become the acting president.

title: Zelensky's Cryptic "What's Next" Reference To Putin After Maduro's Capture
content: Hours after US President Donald Trump announce the capture of Venezuelan Dictator Nicolas Maduro, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky weighed in with an oblique reference to Russian President Vladimir Putin.

title: Big Role For Priyanka Gandhi, She Will Head Congress Panel For Assam Polls
content: In a strategic move ahead of the forthcoming Assembly elections, the Congress party has appointed Priyanka Gandhi Vadra as Chairperson of the Screening Committee for Assam, signalling a high-stakes push in the northeastern state.

title: UK, France Bomb Islamic State Facility In Syria
content: Britain's and France's air forces conducted a joint operation on Saturday evening to bomb a suspected underground arms cache previously used by the Islamic State group in Syria, Britain's defence ministry said.

title: Hyderabad Man Loses 7 Crores To Digital Arrest. Was Named In Fake Drugs Case
content: In a terrifying display of how ruthless and sophisticated cybercriminals have become, an 81-year-old man from Hyderabad, recently lost nearly Rs 7 crore in a meticulously orchestrated "digital arrest" scam.

title: US Venezuela Attack¬†LIVE: Venezuela Vice President To Assume Presidency 'Temporarily' After Maduro's Capture
content: US Strikes on Venezuela and Captured Maduro LIVE Updates: Vice President Delcy Rodriguez will assume the role of acting president of the country in the absence of Nicolas Maduro.

title: 'Watch Your A**': Trump Warns Colombian President After Maduro's Capture
content: Colombian President Gustavo Petro received a warning from his US counterpart Donald Trump, even as Nicolas Maduro was brought to a prison in New York almost a day after Washington launched military Operation Absolute Resolve in Ven

title: Adjustable Window Shades, Deep Wash Basins: Inside First Vande Bharat Sleeper Train
content: Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Saturday said the new-generation Vande Bharat sleeper train would have improved amenities as he walked through the coaches of the train at the New Delhi railway station with mediapersons.

title: "Happy New Year": Venezuela's Maduro's First Remark After Capture By US
content: Nicolas Maduro and his wife, Cilia Flores, were captured during an attack by special US forces on the Venezuelan capital, Caracas, on Saturday.

title: Marble Shopping, Threat To Iran, Capture Maduro: Trump's Holiday Routine
content: On Friday, less than 24 hours before the Venezuela mission, Trump spent almost an hour perusing marble and onyx at an Italian stone importer in a gritty section of Lake Worth Beach for his planned White House ballroom.

title: "He's Killing Too Many People": Trump Says He's "Not Thrilled" With Putin
content: US President Donald Trump said on Saturday he was frustrated with Russian President Vladimir Putin over the continued war in Ukraine, repeating that he had initially believed that ending the war would be easy.

title: Food, Pets, Travel: How US Tracked Venezuela's Maduro For Months
content: US intelligence agents had been secretly monitoring leftist Maduro's every movement since August, despite his widely reported efforts to regularly change locations as tensions mounted with Washington.

title: 'Many Cubans Who Were Protecting Maduro Died In Venezuelan Attack': Trump
content: Neither Venezuela nor the United States has released a death count from the pre-dawn attack that nabbed Maduro, although Trump said no Americans were killed.

title: Explained: Was The US Capture Of Venezuela's Nicolas Maduro Legal?
content: US authorities said the Justice Department sought military assistance to apprehend Maduro, who had been indicted by a New York grand jury along with his wife, son, two political leaders and an alleged leader of an international gang.

title: Seahawks silence 49ers, lock up NFC's No. 1 seed
content: In a performance that would make the Legion of Boom proud, the Seahawks kept the 49ers out of the end zone and won 13-3 to secure the NFC's No. 1 seed.

title: Playoff-hopeful Panthers, Bucs to root for rivals
content: Baker Mayfield threw a touchdown to Cade Otton, Chase McLaughlin kicked three field goals and the Tampa Bay Buccaneers avoided elimination with a sloppy 16-14 victory over the Carolina Panthers on a rain-soaked Saturday at Raymond James Stadium.

title: CMC owns key drop, 49ers lament missed chances
content: Christian McCaffrey owned a bobbled pass that turned into a game-sealing interception, saying it was a play he had to make. The 49ers were unable to make several key plays in their 13-3 loss to Seattle.

title: Amid boos, Baylor's Nnaji debuts in loss at TCU
content: James Nnaji, the 7-foot center and 2023 NBA draft pick whose signing drew criticism from coaches across college basketball last month, debuted Saturday, scoring five points with four fouls in Baylor's 69-63 loss to TCU in the Big 12 opener for both teams.

title: Draymond tossed in win; 'we need him,' Kerr says
content: Warriors forward Draymond Green was ejected for the second time in two weeks after arguing with officials over an uncalled three-second violation Saturday against the Jazz.

title: Embiid's 1st dunk of season fires up rising Sixers
content: Joel Embiid and the Sixers had some fun with his first dunk of the season, an uncontested, two-handed jam that capped the team's 130-119 win over the Knicks on Saturday night.

title: Smith sets Big Ten's assist record, eyes D1 mark
content: No. 5 Purdue guard Braden Smith became the Big Ten's career assists leader, passing Cassius Winston, in an 89-73 win over Wisconsin

title: Top passer Mestemaker commits to Oklahoma St.
content: QB Drew Mestemaker, who leads the country in passing yards this year, told ESPN's Pete Thamel on Saturday that he has committed to Oklahoma State and his former coach, Eric Morris.

title: üèà NFL postseason scenarios: Who can clinch?
content: Two spots remain open in the playoffs, while both No. 1 seeds are up for grabs. Here's everything to know about clinching scenarios for Week 18.

content: Must-win AFC North showdown? No. 1 seeds on the line? We have picks, predictions, stats and what's at stake for every Week 18 game.

content: We'll see 32 picks in Round 1 on April 23, but which prospects have actually earned a first-round grade? Right now, there are 11 in this 2026 class.

content: Here's the latest on proposed salary caps and why the two sides are debating gross and net revenue ahead of the Jan. 9 deadline.

content: Declan Rice scored twice in Arsenal's win at Bournemouth on Saturday, and with goals added to his game, is he now the best midfielder in the world?

title: Amanda Serrano has plenty of options if she stays at featherweight
content: Amanda Serrano got back to winning ways in her return to 126 pounds, and she plans to stay in that division for the foreseeable future.

title: What to watch as the 2026 season begins
content: Can Jordan Chiles lead UCLA to the title? Will Oklahoma win again? All your questions answered as the NCAA gymnastics season starts Friday.

content: A complaint was lodged by an Assistant Engineer of Battarayanapura sub-division, alleging that unidentified persons had pasted posters on roadside transformers

content: Earlier on October 13, the Court had framed charges of cheating, criminal conspiracy, and sections of the Prevention of Corruption Act against the accused persons

title: Proposal to upgrade MCC to Grade 1 civic body: MLA asks officials to keep data ready in one month
content: The State Cabinet has already taken a decision to upgrade the MCC into a Grade 1 civic body by including Hootagalli CMC, Town Panchayats of Rammanahalli, Bogadi, Srirampura and Kadakola besides a few other gram panchayats on the outskirts of Mysuru City.

title: VACB note on legality of foreign funding for Kerala‚Äôs Leader of Opposition, V.D. Satheesan

title: Woman stabbed to death in Uttara Kannada, accused found dead later; Hindu outfits call for bandh
content: "Preliminary investigation suggests that the accused was pressuring the woman to marry him. After she refused, he allegedly attacked her with a knife in public," a police officer said

title: Battered stretches at hairpin curves of Agumbe Ghat to be repaired soon
content: National Highways Division of Public Works Department installs convex mirrors to enhance safety at hairpin bends

title: First flight lands successfully at Bhogapuram International Airport
content: Union Minister K. Rammohan Naidu, accompanied by Vizianagaram MP Kalisetti Appala Naidu and others, came on the flight, which landed at the newly constructed airport‚Äôs 3.8 km long runway

title: BJP uses Gandhi, Lord Ram for propaganda, don't follow their ideals: Surjewala on VB-G RAM G
content: The Congress MP said that while the MGNREGA was totally centrally funded, States will have to bear 40% of the cost under VB-G RAM G

content: Around 500 motorcycles gutted as blaze erupts near second platform; thick smoke seen from kilometres away, fire force battles flames for hours

content: After uniting with Sena (UBT) chief and his cousin Uddhav Thackeray, MNS president Raj Thackeray had declared that ‚ÄúMumbai's mayor will be Marathi, and he will be ours‚Äù

content: The Shah Rukh Khan co-owned IPL franchise Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) released the Bangladesh left-arm pacer, who was bought for ‚Çπ9.20 crore after a bidding war at last month's auctions in Abu Dhabi following BCCI's diktat

title: Assam rehab centre launches hospitality training programme for differently abled
content: Shishu Sarothi‚Äôs certificate course in collaboration with Gateway Institute of Hotel Management covers people with blood disorders, including haemophilia and thalassemia

title: Parivar, party, and the quest for power
content: Cousins Uddhav Thackeray and Raj Thackeray, whose acrimonious split two decades ago had led to a change in the dynamics of regional politics in Maharashtra, have reunited. content: The ground plays an important role in the physical development of numerous children and youngsters, the letter says

content: An analysis of other techniques and systems for core preservation will also be carried out along with the preparation of a blueprint for scientific preservation in the library

content: In a social media post, he said he received minor injuries while his wife, Rupali Baruah, was under observation

title: Rahul Gandhi on a visit to Vietnam to be 'guest' of anti-India people: BJP
content: The BJP had recently alleged that the Congress leader had a meeting with "enemies of India" during his visit to Germany

title: Tamil Nadu government‚Äôs new pension scheme broadly follows the guidelines of Old Pension Scheme

title: Development a key focus, says Thrikkakara municipal chief
content: The idea is to focus on ten key goals and ensure they are met. These include improvements in waste management, ensuring a reliable and adequate water supply, stray dog control, and fostering sustainable urban development, among others, says Rashid Ullamppilly

title: NCC cadets assisted authorities during Operation Sindoor: Lt. Gen. Virendra Vats
content: During the India-Pak. conflict, 75,000 cadets helped the administration, provided medical assistance and arranged voluntary blood donation, says NCC chief

title: Call to preserve the mother tongue for future generations

content: Despite innumerable challenges, she weathered all the challenges and worked tirelessly for the public good, says Haribabu

title: Centre pushes States to speed up farm scheme spending, warns of fund delays
content: Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan said States must ensure funds earmarked for various schemes are spent before March to avoid administrative bottlenecks that delay the effective implementation of programmes

title: Promote khadi, encourage indigenous artisans, says Vijayawada MP
content: It is our responsibility to pass on khadi products as a heritage to the future generations, says Kesineni Sivanath

title: Bihar launches healthcare facilities for elderly at doorsteps
content: The facilities include nursing assistance, pathology tests, blood pressure check, ECG test, physiotherapy and all types of medical assistance in emergency situations.

title: Left parties condemn U.S. ‚Äúaggression‚Äù in Venezuela
content: The CPI, CPI(M) and the All India Forward Bloc all condemned the U.S. strikes on the Latin American country and the capture of President Nicol√°s Maduro

title: Hopeful that DMK will conclude seat-sharing talks at the earliest: Girish Chodankar
content: He says the Congress has received close to 5,000 applications from aspiring candidates and the conclusion of the seat-sharing negotiations is essential as the party can then concentrate on choosing the candidates and campaigning

title: Barber held for playing 'anti-national' songs at his shop in Palghar district
content: According to locals who complained to the police, he allegedly played provocative content regularly, ignoring previous warnings, an official said

title: Those who lost homes in Kogilu to hold a rally today; BJP to protest on Monday
content: GBA and Rajiv Gandhi Housing Corporation Ltd. have finalised the list of those eligible for alternative housing in Kogilu Layout. However, verification by the Ashraya Committee is awaited

title: DVAC seizes unaccounted cash, gold coins, new silk sarees at DRDA Project Director‚Äôs office in Ranipet
content: Directorate of Vigilance and Anti-Corruption (DVAC) officials said that residents have complained of irregularities including extra charge and commission for sanctioning works in rural areas

title: Congress announces panels for poll-bound States; Priyanka to head screening committee for Assam election
content: While Ms. Vadra will head the screening committee for Assam, other members of the panel include Lok Sabha MP Saptagiri Ulaka and Rajya Sabha MP Imran Masood

title: National Education Policy will bring country's new generation out of Macaulay mentality: Pradhan
content: The NEP, announced on July 29, 2020, proposes various reforms in school education as well as higher and technical education

title: CM accuses KCR of Kaleshwaram type exploitation in PRLIS too
content: Revanth Reddy vows to draw water from Jurala for the project in case clearances are not given to PRLIS with Srisailam as source

title: Andaman & Nicobar Islands will be a major contributor to India‚Äôs treasury in 10 years: Amit Shah
content: Union Home Minister inaugurates and lays foundation stones for various projects worth ‚Çπ373 crore in the archipelago. He also chairs a Parliamentary Consultative Committee meeting focused on issues of national security, disaster management, cyber security and regional infrastructure.

title: Three-year jail term for Kerala MLA Antony Raju in tampering with evidence case
content: Raju, a leader of the Janadhipathya Kerala Congress, an LDF ally, will be disqualified as an MLA on account of his conviction in the case; Although the court sentenced him to three years in jail, he was granted bail and one month‚Äôs time to appeal against the verdict

title: West Bengal SIR: Cases of ‚Äòlogical discrepancies‚Äô in progeny mapping come down to 95 lakh
content: The Election Commission of India officials had earlier flagged 1.67 crore cases of suspicious progeny mapping with the 2002 electoral roll

title: Security heightened along Bangladesh border in Tripura
content: The vigil along the border was increased after reports of the movement of members of two Bangladesh-based armed groups

title: Army signs deal to procure long-range rocket launchers Suryastra
content: It has signed a ‚Çπ293 crore contract with NIBE Limited, backed by Israeli technology, for an advanced long-range rocket launcher system, in collaboration with Israel, with strike capabilities of 150 km and 300 km

title: Too little, too late: Congress on Centre‚Äôs 90-day threshold for gig workers‚Äô social security
content: The Opposition argued that the Centre‚Äôs vision for the unorganised sector falls short of the provisions made out by Congress governments in Telangana, Rajasthan, and Karnataka to support gig workers

title: Trinamool MP Mausam Noor returns to the Congress
content: ‚ÄòWest Bengal wants change,‚Äô the two-time Lok Sabha MP says after joining the Congress, in whose leadership she says she has complete faith

title: Odisha Police begin probe into alleged violation of power by aide of Naveen Patnaik

title: Stray dog attack exposes safety lapses at Kochi taluk hospital

title: CITU to fight against move to privatise education, health and job sectors

title: Supreme Court to pronounce verdict in bail pleas of Umar Khalid, others in Delhi riots case on January 5
content: The appellants are accused of being the ‚Äòmasterminds‚Äô behind the riots, which left 53 people dead and over 700 injured; violence had erupted during protests against the Citizenship Amendment Act and the National Register of Citizens

title: TTD to leverage VR, AR to highlight local, affiliated temples

title: Stalemate over demolition of Chander Kunj Army Towers continues to New Year

title: Spirituality makes people become good citizens in society: Vice-President

title: World Series champion Orioles? Skubal blockbuster?
content: we asked our experts to give their boldest predictions for what the new year will bring . a look into the crystal ball for the topics that will have us all talking in 2026 . the Baltimore Orioles finished last in the AL East in 2025, but their 75 wins were the most .

title: College football transfer portal: Tracking who's on the move
content: Max Olson ranks Cincinnati's Brendan Sorsby as the top player in the transfer portal and predicts a recruitment battle between Texas Tech and LSU. (1:04) College football's transfer portal officially opened at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. By midday on Day 1, more than 4,500 Division I college football players have entered the transfer portal. Players now have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.

title: Quarterfinal takeaways: Ole Miss' wild upset, Indiana's dominance, more
content: the second edition of the college football playoff quarterfinals gave us two classics and two statement wins . on Wednesday, no. 10 Miami rode an early 14-0 burst and a clutch late touchdown drive to a 24-14 upset of no. 2 Ohio State . the Hurricanes advanced to the semis to face no. 6 Ole Miss .

title: Testing grit and willpower with 7 marathons, 7 continents in 7 days
content: WOLF's FANG RUNWAY in Antarctica ranks among the most desolate, unwelcoming places on the planet . 54 runners stepped off their charter plane on Nov. 16 and steeled themselves for the 26.2 miles of marathon hell ahead . the race took them in a matter of hours from the lung-freezing cold of Antarctica to the 94-degree heat of Perth, Australia .

title: No NFC South champ until Sunday after Bucs beat Panthers
content: the Tampa Bay Buccaneers beat the Carolina Panthers 16-14 to win the NFC South . if the Saints defeat the Falcons on Sunday, the Bucs would secure the division at 8-9 . it would mark the first time a team has won five straight division championships since 2002 .

title: MVPs for every bowl game: Wake Forest's Ashford caps six-year career with five-TD night
content: the 2025-26 bowl season has reached its end, but college football experts have highlighted the best performances from the past month . we've picked MVPs from each of the 36 bowl games from Dec. 13 to Jan. 2 . QB Robby Ashford stewarded one of the nation's most surprising success stories this fall .

title: Seahawks silence 49ers' offense in Week 18, win NFC's No. 1 seed
content: the Seattle Seahawks are heading to the playoffs as the NFC's no. 1 seed . the conference's top seed on the line, Mike Macdonald's team grounded and pounded its way to a 13-3 victory . in a battle of the NFL's second-best scoring defense, the seahawks won out .
